title: Man determined to get a burger shoves climate protesters out of the way
text:
The man shoved his way through the protesters (Picture: Twitter)

An angry man has been filmed pushing his way through Extinction Rebellion protesters so he can get himself a burger.

In a video shared on social media, the man can be seen shouting at activists in Danish outside a burger chain in Denmark.

He tells the group, who appear to be holding Extinction Rebellion flags, that he will ‘run through’ unless they ‘f**king move’.

The man then tries to aggressively push himself into the crowd, with one protester struggling to grab his arm.

He then turns back and furiously threatens to hit the campaigner, before asking the crowd: ‘Do you have a f**king problem?’.

Warning: Strong language.

climate change protest wimps ! try to stop a real man from getting his beefburger pic.twitter.com/1ST1NV4wVf — Neiljetel (@neiljetel) October 3, 2019

He tells the protesters to ‘behave themselves’ before squaring up to a long-haired activist and shouting: ‘You f**king hippies!’

The short clip was uploaded to VidMax and has since gone viral in Twitter.

Climate Change demonstrations are taking place across the globe this week as part of a fortnight of Extinction Rebellion civil disobedience.

Activists in Aarhus, Denmark, are taking part in the protests, alongside countries such as Germany, France, Spain, Australia, India and New Zealand.

Extinction Rebellion say it is their biggest movement yet, with more than 850 events planned across 60 cities worldwide.

He swore at the group and called them hippies (Picture: Twitter)

Those in London held an ‘opening ceremony’ by Marble Arch last night as an official start to the protests.

A spokesperson for the environmentalist group said they were seeking to ‘pressure the government into action’.

Man 'raped pregnant girlfriend to try and kill their unborn baby'

Zoe Jones, 24, said: ‘The next two weeks will involve marches and family friendly events, there’ll be some spicier actions as well and some will be arrestable.

‘We’ve had 4,000 rebels sign up and say they are willing to be arrested – which is a huge increase on the number arrested in April of 1,000.

‘The public perception of XR is that we’re disrupting ordinary people’s lives by blocking roads and that’s why this time we’re taking our protests to the seat of power and taking it to Westminster.

‘We are on the public’s side and we are ordinary people who are extremely concerned.’

description: An angry man has been filmed pushing his way through Extinction Rebellion protesters so he can get himself a burger in Denmark.
